task: Create a new note on the canvas. You can use keyboard shortcuts, the toolbar, or any other method you can find.
persona: Sarah â€” Obsidian power user (5000+ notes, uses keyboard shortcuts daily)

action.thinking:
I can see a welcome dialog in the center of the screen that says 'Your canvas is ready'. There are several options shown:
1. 'New Note' option with a document icon
2. 'Double-click to create a conversation' 
3. 'Press Ctrl+K to open command palette'
4. Keyboard shortcuts for creating notes (Shift+N), conversations (Shift+C), and tasks (Shift+T)
5. 'Press ? for all keyboard shortcuts'

The most direct way to create a new note would be to click on the 'New Note' option that's visible in the dialog, or use the Shift+N keyboard shortcut. Since I'm a power user who uses keyboard shortcuts daily, I'll use Shift+N.
action.target: keyboard shortcut to create new note
action.reason: Using the keyboard shortcut Shift+N as indicated in the welcome dialog to create a new note. This is the most efficient method for a power user.

action.thinking: I can see that a new note has been created on the canvas. There are now two note cards visible - one in the top-left corner and one in the center of the canvas, both labeled 'New Note' with '0 words'. The right panel shows the properties for the selected note. At the bottom of the screen, there's a confirmation message 'New note created'. The task was to create a new note, and this has been accomplished successfully using the Shift+N keyboard shortcut.
action.reason: A new note has been successfully created on the canvas using the Shift+N keyboard shortcut. The note is visible in the center of the canvas with the title 'New Note', and a confirmation message 'New note created' appears at the bottom of the screen.
